places.name: Rome
places.description: Capital of Italy, liberated by Allied forces on June 4, 1944. First Axis capital to fall.
places.significance: Site of John's papal audience at Santa Susanna church

places.name: Naples
places.description: Major port city in southern Italy, captured by Allies in October 1943. Key logistics hub for the Italian Campaign.
places.significance: Primary supply port for Allied operations in Italy

places.name: Cassino
places.description: Site of the Battle of Monte Cassino, four major assaults from January to May 1944 to break the German Winter Line.
places.significance: One of the bloodiest battles of the Italian Campaign

places.name: Venice
places.description: Historic canal city in northeastern Italy, liberated in late April 1945.
places.significance: Mentioned in V-E Day letter; John describes gondola rides

places.name: Florence
places.description: Renaissance city in northern Italy. The 985th FA Battalion was stationed in the Florence area from August 1944 to April 1945 during Gothic Line operations.
places.significance: Base of operations during the Gothic Line campaign

places.name: Salerno
places.description: Site of Operation Avalanche, the main Allied landing on mainland Italy on September 9, 1943.
places.significance: Beginning of the Italian mainland campaign

places.name: Anzio
places.description: Site of Operation Shingle, an amphibious landing on January 22, 1944 intended to outflank the Winter Line.
places.significance: Costly beachhead that was trapped for four months before breakout

places.name: North Africa (Tunisia)
places.description: North African staging area where Allied forces prepared for the invasion of Sicily and Italy after the Tunisia Campaign ended in May 1943.
places.significance: Staging area before the invasion of Italy

places.name: Milwaukee, Wisconsin
places.description: Largest city in Wisconsin, major industrial center during WWII.
places.significance: John Donahue's hometown; where letters were sent and received

places.name: Janesville, Wisconsin
places.description: City in southern Wisconsin, about 70 miles southwest of Milwaukee.
places.significance: Mentioned in Lutie's letter to the family

places.name: Fort Sill, Oklahoma
places.description: U.S. Army installation and Field Artillery School, established 1869. Major training center during WWII.
places.significance: John's training base before deployment overseas
